channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Boeing 787 Crash in India Brings Fresh Scrutiny to Plane Maker’s Safety Record
item.description: The accident happened just weeks after the company cut a deal with the U.S. government to avoid taking criminal responsibility for a pair of deadly cr...

item.title: Motel 6 is being sued by its longtime spokesperson Tom Bodett
How “Pet Sounds” Became the Beach Boys Masterpiece
item.description: Brian Wilson’s 1966 masterpiece is now considered a crowning achievement of music. The album’s reputation grew over time.

item.title: Xerox CEO Steve Bandrowczak on what no one tells you about the top job
item.description: CEO Steve Bandrowczak's first lesson for aspiring leaders is to get comfortable with discomfort.

item.title: Suspect in Austrian School Shooting Was a Loner Rejected by Army, Officials Say
item.description: A defense official said the man, 21, was turned down for military service after failing a psychological test. Investigators are asking how he passed a...

item.title: Planning to watch a show on Prime Video? Brace yourself for twice as many ads
item.description: Ad breaks could last as long as six minutes now.

item.title: Spotify’s new HR leader masterminded her company’s remote work policy and gives one piece of key advice
item.description: We don't know what the future will hold, but the bet we're taking is making everyone AI ready.”

item.title: Supreme Court Revives Suit From Victims of Botched F.B.I. Raid
item.description: Lower courts ruled in favor of agents who had used a battering ram and a flash-bang grenade in mistakenly raiding the home of an Atlanta couple.

item.title: Republicans to Press Hochul, Walz and Pritzker on Immigration in Hearing
item.description: Amid unrest in California, Republicans pressed the governors of other blue states on their immigration policies, including on limiting cooperation wit...

item.title: The fear factor is real: Workers won’t leave their jobs even if they hate them because they’re so anxious about the economy
item.description: While layoff rates have stayed consistently low, workers are worried about what’s to come.

item.title: Live Updates: Over 200 Dead in Air India Crash, Official Says
item.description: The London-bound Boeing Dreamliner went down moments after takeoff in Ahmedabad, India, with 242 people aboard. It was unclear if anyone survived. The...

item.title: U.N. Watchdog Rules That Iran Is Not Complying With Nuclear Obligations
item.description: The decision comes as officials say they believe that Israel is preparing to launch a military attack on Iran. Tehran condemned the vote.

item.title: Why Israel May Be Considering an Attack on Iran
item.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has vowed to prevent Tehran, “one way or the other,” from building a nuclear bomb.

item.title: Chaos At Site of Air India Plane Crash
item.description: Firefighters raced to douse smoking buildings as emergency workers recovered bodies after a deadly passenger plane crash in India.

item.title: Photos and Video From the Scene of the Deadly Air India Crash
item.description: A passenger flight traveling from Ahmedabad, a city in western India, to London crashed shortly after takeoff.
